content: Is it possible to add custom css on the hosted Zulip offering? I'd like to try out some small design changes without having to deploy my own instance.
Curious to know what changes you want to try?

I'm not super happy with how the selected message looks like. So I was thinking of doing something more subtle, like showing a little colored bullet next to the time for the currently selected message.
@Denis you could always use Stylebot :)
not happy with how it looks here, or how it looks on zulipchat.com?
@Denis we're experimenting with the selected message box right now, so would love input on what you like/don't like about it

@Rishi Gupta I'm using the hosted release. It seems you've already changed it somewhat here (for the better).

The problem I see with it is how prominent the box shadow is for something that I personally find not that important. In my opinion it should be a bit more subtle. So maybe a little dot next to the time or outline around it. Or a dot before the message to the left. Or a left-border. Maybe it could also be a bit more daring and use a different background color (say a light yellow).
interesting! And sorry for the delayed reply. Do you use the r keyboard shortcut to reply, or do you generally click on the message?
To keep this issue in mind, I have decided to add this feature in the desktop app so that users can add their custom CSS, #D432.
